mix.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: if you mix two or more substances or if they mix, they combine to become a single substance, and they cannot be easily separated
mix.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Shake the bottle well so that the oil mixes with the vinegar.
The powder is mixed with cold water to form a paste.
Mix the soured cream with ketchup.
First mix the butter and sugar together, then add the milk.
Mix the herbs into the sauce.
mix.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to combine two or more different activities, ideas, groups of things etc
mix.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Their musical style mixes elements of Eastern culture and Western pop.
His books mix historical fact with fantasy.
I don’t like to mix business with pleasure (=combine business and social activities at the same time).
mix.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: to meet, talk, and spend time with other people, especially people you do not know very well
mix.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Charlie doesn’t mix well with the other children.
mix.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: to prepare something, especially food or drink, by mixing things together
mix.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: Will you mix us some martinis, Bill?
mix.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: to control the balance of sounds in a record or film
mix.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: the particular combination of things or people in a group or thing
mix.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: the region’s rich ethnic mix  (=people of different races)
We felt that between us we had the right mix of skills.
a complicated mix of colours and textures
mix.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: a combination of substances that you mix together to make something such as a cake
mix.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: Add water to the cake mix and bake at 375°F.
mix.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: a particular arrangement of sounds, voices, or different pieces of music used on a pop record
mix.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: a group of different things combined together for a particular purpose
mix.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: If the investment manager picks the right mix of bonds, his total return should rise quickly.
